pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:6.1: 1. The second training rule on lifted robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:5.1: Venerables, these rules to be trained in come up for recitation.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:7.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:7.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six wore their sarongs hanging down in front and behind.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:7.4: “How can the nuns wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.1: Then nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.4: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind?” After criticizing those nuns in many ways, they told the Master. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.5: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.8: How can the nuns from the group of six wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind?
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:8.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:9.1: ‘“I will wear the sarong evenly all around,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:10.1: One should wear the sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:10.2: If a nun, out of disrespect, wears the sarong hanging down in front or behind, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:11.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:13.1: Nuns’ Training 75: the training rule on defecating in water
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:14.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:14.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:14.4: “How can the nuns defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.5: who in turn told the Master.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.8: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.11: How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.12: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:15.13: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:16.1: ‘“I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:17.1: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:18.1: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick nuns did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:18.3: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to defecate, urinate, and spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:18.4: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:19.1: ‘“When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:20.1: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:20.2: If, out of disrespect, a nun who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:22.1: The fifteenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:22.2: The seventh chapter on shoes is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:23.1: “Venerables, the rules on training have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:23.2: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:23.8: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1-75:24.1: The chapter on training is finished.
